Day of Defeat is a game based around close quarters, team-based, asymetrical gameplay. it is a mix between a realistic, tactical, and arcade shooter. gunfights are brutal and quick, this game is very skill-based, and can be played both casually and as a great E-sport. but one of the favourite things about the original day of defeat is the art style. some may look at DOD's graphics and think it is ugly and dated, but I love it. the game's art style is inspired by the paintings of Otto Dix like der krieg and the movie Saving Private Ryan. every texture is extremely gritty in a way that new games just cant do. DOD uses the gold source engine's dated graphics to create a horrific and disturbing portrayal of war. this combined with the game's brutal, meat grinder game play, and entrenched MG/sniper positions from other players, proves that video games, even multiplayer ones, are works of art capable of displaying themes of war and destruction. your standard match of day of defeat is an utter hell scape, there are entrenched machine gunners, snipers, destroyed buildings, explosives being thrown everywhere, and you have to make it through all of that just to get a chance at the objective. if you aren't killed by stumbling across one of the hundreds of grenades liberally thrown around every match, then its more than likely that machine gunner or sniper will pick you off. but when you do encounter other infantrymen, the combat will be brutal and fast paced. every map is filled with twists and turns to be ambushed from. it truly is one of the most terrifying depictions of urban warfare from any piece of art. I would highly recommend.

This is easily Valve's most underrated game, it is a lot of fun. It has a good mix of strategy and challenge without ever feeling too cheap or unfair about it, and also has a pretty nice amount of historical accuracy. It isn't the most historically accurate game ever made, but it does just enough that people familiar enough with WW2 will appreciate it. Wish more people played it, and wish Day of Defeat: Source had more content to expand upon this game.

[h1]Comentario Analítico: "Day of Defeat"[/h1]

Para tratarse de un clásico multijugador de Valve propio de la era de Half-Life 1, me tomó muchísimos años decidir probar Day of Defeat.

Similar a Ricochet, Deathmatch Classic y (parcialmente) Team Fortress Classic, al entrar a buscar servidores se fracasará al intentar encontrar una comunidad muy activa. Aún así, éste cuenta con 131 personas jugándolo ahora mismo, muy superior a los números de Ricochet y dentro hay un par de servidores con 3 o 2 personas.

Day of Defeat fue una grata sorpresa. Cuenta con excelentes detalles de ambientación (Para la época) y mecánicas inusuales en títulos que corren en Gold Source, tales como la estamina o algunas características secundarias de varias armas.

Más allá de ello, es el modelo de juego de Counter-Strike 1.6 pero ambientado en la Segunda Guerra Mundial.

[b]¿En conclusión?[/b] Me esperaba algo más simple y aburrido, fue una grata sorpresa.

WW 2

CS 1.6 gibi kendisi de zamanında Half Life modu olan bir oyun. CS 1.6 kadar başarılı olamasa da WW2 temasıyla sevenlerini bir araya toplamayı başardı. Başardı başarmasına ama ne yazık ki CS 1.6 gibi kalıcı olamadı. Şuan ölmüş bir oyun olmamakla beraber VALVE'nin GoldSrc ile yapılmış (CS 1.6 HARİÇ) tüm oyunları
gibi ölüme terk edilmiş durumda. Diğer oyunlar gibi tam anlamıyla ölmese de ölümü çok da uzak görünmüyor. Aktif işleyen 10 sunucusu falan var. Bu 10 sunucuda genel olarak çok dolu olmasalar da boş da sayılmazlar. 4ü Çin sunucusu olduğundan onları saymıyorum, 1-2'si arada full bile çekiyor.
Oyuna gelirsek oynaması keyifli. Bölgelerdeki bayrakları kendi bayrağımız yapmaya çalışırken birbirimizle çatıştığımız bir WW2 oyunu.
Oyunu tekil olarak almak ne kadar mantıklıdır bilemiyorum ama VALVE COMPLETE PACK ile almak çok mantıklıdır diye düşünüyorum.
